title: Contributing to resmush
text: outlines propose change resmush. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to resmush
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ‚Äôll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to resmush
text: want make bigger change, ‚Äôs good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ‚Äôs needed. ‚Äôve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to resmush
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven‚Äôt done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("dieghernan/resmush", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn‚Äôt pass cleanly, ‚Äôs good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e.¬†just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to resmush
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use Air apply style, please don‚Äôt restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to resmush
text: contributing guide adapted tidyverse contributing guide available https://tidyverse.tidyverse.org/CONTRIBUTING.html.

title: Using resmush
text: Compressing online jpg image: () (b) Figure¬†1: Original picture Figure¬†1 (): 178.7 Kb; Optimized picture Figure¬†1 (b): 45 Kb (Compression: 74.8%). Click enlarge. compression quality jpg files can adjusted using qlty argument. However, recommended keep value 90 maintain good image quality.  Figure¬†2: Low quality image due high compression rate, compare Figure¬†1 (b). functions return (invisibly) dataset summarizing process. following example shows works compressing local file:
code: library(resmush)  url <- "https://dieghernan.github.io/resmush/img/jpg_example_original.jpg"  resmush_url(url, outfile = "jpg_example_compress.jpg", overwrite = TRUE) #> ‚ïê‚ïê resmush summary ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê #> ‚Ñπ Input: 1 url with size 178.7 Kb #> ‚úî Success for 1 url: Size now is 45 Kb (was 178.7 Kb). Saved 133.7 Kb (74.82%). #> See result in directory '.'. # Extreme case resmush_url(   url,   outfile = tempfile(fileext = ".jpg"),   overwrite = TRUE,   qlty = 3 ) #> ‚ïê‚ïê resmush summary ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê #> ‚Ñπ Input: 1 url with size 178.7 Kb #> ‚úî Success for 1 url: Size now is 2.2 Kb (was 178.7 Kb). Saved 176.4 Kb (98.74%). #> See result in directory 'tempdir()'. png_file <- system.file("extimg/example.png", package = "resmush")  # For the example, copy to a temporary file tmp_png <- tempfile(fileext = ".png") file.copy(png_file, tmp_png, overwrite = TRUE) #> [1] TRUE  summary <- resmush_file(tmp_png, overwrite = TRUE)  tibble::as_tibble(summary[, -c(1, 2)]) #> # A tibble: 1 √ó 6 #>   src_size dest_size compress_ratio notes src_bytes dest_bytes #>   <chr>    <chr>     <chr>          <chr>     <dbl>      <dbl> #> 1 239.9 Kb 70.7 Kb   70.54%         OK       245618      72356

title: Using resmush
text: Several R packages also provide image optimization tools: xfun::tinify(): Similar resmush_file() uses TinyPNG requires API key. xfun::optipng(): Compresses local files using OptiPNG, must installed locally. tinieR jmablog: R interface TinyPNG. optout @coolbutuseless: Similar xfun::optipng() options. Requires additional local software. Table¬†1: R packages: Comparison alternatives optimizing images. Table¬†2: R packages: Supported formats.

code: @Manual{R-resmush,   title = {{resmush}: Optimize and Compress Image Files with {reSmush.it}},   doi = {10.32614/CRAN.package.resmush},   author = {Diego Hernang√≥mez},   year = {2026},   version = {0.2.2.9001},   url = {https://dieghernan.github.io/resmush/},   abstract = {Compress local and online images using the reSmush.it API service <https://resmush.it/>.}, }

what: resmush | Optimize and Compress Image Files with reSmush.it
title: resmush | Optimize and Compress Image Files with reSmush.it
text: resmush R package allows users optimize compress images using reSmush.. reSmush.free API provides image optimization implemented WordPress many tools. features reSmush.include: Free optimization services API key required. Support local online images. Supported image formats: png, jpg/jpeg, gif, bmp, tiff. Maximum image size: 5 MB. PNGQuant: Removes unnecessary chunks png files preserving full alpha transparency. JPEGOptim: Lossless optimization based Huffman table optimization. OptiPNG: png optimizer used several online compression tools.

title: resmush | Optimize and Compress Image Files with reSmush.it
text: Check docs developing version https://dieghernan.github.io/resmush/dev/. can install development version resmush GitHub : Alternatively, install resmush using r-universe:
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("dieghernan/resmush") # Install resmush in R: install.packages(   "resmush",   repos = c(     "https://dieghernan.r-universe.dev",     "https://cloud.r-project.org"   ) )

title: resmush | Optimize and Compress Image Files with reSmush.it
text: Compressing online jpg image: () (b) Figure 1: Original picture (): 178.7 Kb; Optimized picture (b): 45 Kb (Compression: 74.8%). Click enlarge. compression quality jpg files can adjusted using qlty argument. However, recommended keep value 90 maintain good image quality.  Figure 2: Low quality image due high compression rate. functions return (invisibly) dataset summarizing process. following example shows works compressing local file:
code: library(resmush)  url <- "https://dieghernan.github.io/resmush/img/jpg_example_original.jpg"  resmush_url(   url,   outfile = "man/figures/jpg_example_compress.jpg",   overwrite = TRUE ) #> ‚ïê‚ïê resmush summary ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê #> ‚Ñπ Input: 1 url with size 178.7 Kb #> ‚úî Success for 1 url: Size now is 45 Kb (was 178.7 Kb). Saved 133.7 Kb (74.82%). #> See result in directory 'man/figures'. # Extreme case resmush_url(   url,   outfile = "man/figures/jpg_example_compress_low.jpg",   overwrite = TRUE,   qlty = 3 ) #> ‚ïê‚ïê resmush summary ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê #> ‚Ñπ Input: 1 url with size 178.7 Kb #> ‚úî Success for 1 url: Size now is 2.2 Kb (was 178.7 Kb). Saved 176.4 Kb (98.74%). #> See result in directory 'man/figures'. png_file <- system.file("extimg/example.png", package = "resmush")  # For the example, copy to a temporary file tmp_png <- tempfile(fileext = ".png") file.copy(png_file, tmp_png, overwrite = TRUE) #> [1] TRUE  summary <- resmush_file(tmp_png, overwrite = TRUE)  tibble::as_tibble(summary[, -c(1, 2)]) #> # A tibble: 1 √ó 6 #>   src_size dest_size compress_ratio notes src_bytes dest_bytes #>   <chr>    <chr>     <chr>          <chr>     <dbl>      <dbl> #> 1 239.9 Kb 70.7 Kb   70.54%         OK       245618      72356

what: Helper function for cleaning files created by resmush ‚Äî resmush_clean_dir

title: Helper function for cleaning files created by resmush ‚Äî resmush_clean_dir
Helper function for cleaning files created by resmush ‚Äî resmush_clean_dir
text: dir character vector full path names. See list.files(), path argument. suffix Character, defaults "_resmush". See resmush_file(). recursive Logical. file search recurse directories?

title: Helper function for cleaning files created by resmush ‚Äî resmush_clean_dir
text: invisible() NULL value. Produces messages information process.

title: Helper function for cleaning files created by resmush ‚Äî resmush_clean_dir
code: # \donttest{ # Simple example  png_file <- system.file("extimg/example.png", package = "resmush")  # Copy to a temporary file with a given suffix suffix <- "_would_be_removed" tmp_png <- file.path(   tempdir(),   paste0("example", suffix, ".png") )  file.exists(tmp_png) #> [1] FALSE file.copy(png_file, tmp_png, overwrite = TRUE) #> [1] TRUE  file.exists(tmp_png) #> [1] TRUE  # This won't remove it resmush_clean_dir(tempdir()) #> ‚Ñπ No files to clean in /tmp/RtmpAjPXvd with suffix "_resmush\\.".  file.exists(tmp_png) #> [1] TRUE  # Need suffix resmush_clean_dir(tempdir(), suffix = suffix) #> ‚Ñπ Would remove 1 file: #> ‚Üí /tmp/RtmpAjPXvd/example_would_be_removed.png  file.exists(tmp_png) #> [1] FALSE # }

what: Optimize files of several directories ‚Äî resmush_dir
title: Optimize files of several directories ‚Äî resmush_dir
text: Optimize local files directory (list directories) using  reSmush.API.

title: Optimize files of several directories ‚Äî resmush_dir
code: resmush_dir(   dir,   ext = "\\.(png|jpe?g|bmp|gif|tif)$",   suffix = "_resmush",   overwrite = FALSE,   progress = TRUE,   report = TRUE,   recursive = FALSE,   ... )

title: Optimize files of several directories ‚Äî resmush_dir
text: dir Character vector characters representing paths local directories. ext regex indicating extensions files optimized. default value capture extensions admitted API. suffix Character, defaults "_resmush". default, new file suffix created directory (.e., optimized example.png example_resmush.png). Values "", NA NULL overwrite = TRUE. overwrite Logical. files dir overwritten? TRUE suffix ignored. progress Logical. Display progress bar needed. report Logical. Display summary report process console. See also Value. recursive Logical. dir file search recursive? See also list.files(). ... Arguments passed resmush_file qlty affects jpg files. Integer 0 100 indicating optimization level. optimal results use values 90. exif_preserve Logical. Exif information () deleted? Default remove (.e. exif_preserve = FALSE).

title: Optimize files of several directories ‚Äî resmush_dir
text: Writes disk optimized file API call successful directories specified dir. cases, (invisible()) data frame summary process returned well.

title: Optimize files of several directories ‚Äî resmush_dir
code: # \donttest{ # Get example dir and copy example_dir <- system.file("extimg", package = "resmush") temp_dir <- tempdir() file.copy(example_dir, temp_dir, recursive = TRUE) #> [1] TRUE  # Dest folder  dest_folder <- file.path(tempdir(), "extimg")  # Non-recursive resmush_dir(dest_folder) #> ‚Ñπ Resmushing 2 files #> üïê  Go! | ‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°   50% [2ms] | ETA:  0s (1/2 files) #> üïê  Go! | ‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†  100% [1.2s] | ETA:  0s (2/2 files) #>  #> ‚ïê‚ïê resmush summary ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê #> ‚Ñπ Input: 2 files with size 340.2 Kb #> ‚úî Success for 2 files: Size now is 153.8 Kb (was 340.2 Kb). Saved 186.4 Kb (54.79%). #> See results in directory /tmp/RtmpAjPXvd/extimg. resmush_clean_dir(dest_folder) #> ‚Ñπ Would remove 2 files: #> ‚Üí /tmp/RtmpAjPXvd/extimg/example_resmush.jpg #> ‚Üí /tmp/RtmpAjPXvd/extimg/example_resmush.png  # Recursive summary <- resmush_dir(dest_folder, recursive = TRUE) #> ‚Ñπ Resmushing 5 files #> üïê  Go! | ‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°   40% [608ms] | ETA:  1s (2/5 files) #> üïê  Go! | ‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†  100% [2.9s] | ETA:  0s (5/5 files) #>  #> ‚ïê‚ïê resmush summary ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê #> ‚Ñπ Input: 5 files with size 401.7 Kb #> ‚úî Success for 5 files: Size now is 173.5 Kb (was 401.7 Kb). Saved 228.2 Kb (56.81%). #> See results in directories /tmp/RtmpAjPXvd/extimg, #> /tmp/RtmpAjPXvd/extimg/top1/nested, /tmp/RtmpAjPXvd/extimg/top1, and #> /tmp/RtmpAjPXvd/extimg/top2.  # Same info in the invisible df summary[, -c(1, 2)] #>   src_size dest_size compress_ratio notes src_bytes dest_bytes #> 1 100.4 Kb   83.2 Kb         17.15%    OK    102796      85164 #> 2 239.9 Kb   70.7 Kb         70.54%    OK    245618      72356 #> 3  17.8 Kb      6 Kb         66.48%    OK     18214       6105 #> 4  25.9 Kb    7.7 Kb         70.09%    OK     26499       7926 #> 5  17.8 Kb      6 Kb         66.48%    OK     18214       6105  # Display with png if (require("png", quietly = TRUE)) {   a_png <- grepl("png$", summary$dest_img)   my_png <- png::readPNG(summary[a_png, ]$dest_img[2])   grid::grid.raster(my_png) }   # Clean up example unlink(dest_folder, force = TRUE, recursive = TRUE) # }

title: Optimize a local file ‚Äî resmush_file
text: Optimize local images using reSmush.API.

title: Optimize a local file ‚Äî resmush_file
code: resmush_file(   file,   suffix = "_resmush",   overwrite = FALSE,   progress = TRUE,   report = TRUE,   qlty = 92,   exif_preserve = FALSE )

title: Optimize a local file ‚Äî resmush_file
text: file Path paths local files. reSmush can optimize following image files: png jpg/jpeg gif bmp tiff suffix Character, defaults "_resmush". default, new file suffix created directory file. (.e., optimized example.png example_resmush.png). Values "", NA NULL overwrite = TRUE. overwrite Logical. file file overwritten? TRUE suffix ignored. progress Logical. Display progress bar needed. report Logical. Display summary report process console. See also Value. qlty affects jpg files. Integer 0 100 indicating optimization level. optimal results use values 90. exif_preserve Logical. Exif information () deleted? Default remove (.e. exif_preserve = FALSE).

title: Optimize a local file ‚Äî resmush_file
text: Writes disk optimized file API call successful directory file. option report = TRUE summary report displayed console. cases, (invisible()) data frame summary process used generate report returned.

title: Optimize a local file ‚Äî resmush_file
code: # \donttest{ png_file <- system.file("extimg/example.png", package = "resmush")  # For the example, copy to a temporary file tmp_png <- tempfile(fileext = ".png")  file.copy(png_file, tmp_png, overwrite = TRUE) #> [1] TRUE  resmush_file(tmp_png) #> ‚ïê‚ïê resmush summary ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê #> ‚Ñπ Input: 1 file with size 239.9 Kb #> ‚úî Success for 1 file: Size now is 70.7 Kb (was 239.9 Kb). Saved 169.2 Kb (70.54%). #> See result in directory /tmp/RtmpAjPXvd.  # Several paths jpg_file <- system.file("extimg/example.jpg", package = "resmush") tmp_jpg <- tempfile(fileext = ".jpg")  file.copy(jpg_file, tmp_jpg, overwrite = TRUE) #> [1] TRUE  # Output summary in console summary <- resmush_file(c(tmp_png, tmp_jpg)) #> üïê  Go! | ‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°   50% [1ms] | ETA:  0s (1/2 files) #> üïê  Go! | ‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†  100% [1.1s] | ETA:  0s (2/2 files) #>  #> ‚ïê‚ïê resmush summary ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê #> ‚Ñπ Input: 2 files with size 340.2 Kb #> ‚úî Success for 2 files: Size now is 153.8 Kb (was 340.2 Kb). Saved 186.4 Kb (54.79%). #> See results in directory /tmp/RtmpAjPXvd.  # Similar info in an (invisible) data frame as a result summary #>                                src_img #> 1 /tmp/RtmpAjPXvd/file1a6d77201dc1.png #> 2 /tmp/RtmpAjPXvd/file1a6d5842da0d.jpg #>                                       dest_img src_size dest_size #> 1 /tmp/RtmpAjPXvd/file1a6d77201dc1_resmush.png 239.9 Kb   70.7 Kb #> 2 /tmp/RtmpAjPXvd/file1a6d5842da0d_resmush.jpg 100.4 Kb   83.2 Kb #>   compress_ratio notes src_bytes dest_bytes #> 1         70.54%    OK    245618      72356 #> 2         17.15%    OK    102796      85164  # Display with png if (require("png", quietly = TRUE)) {   my_png <- png::readPNG(summary$dest_img[1])   grid::grid.raster(my_png) }   # With parameters resmush_file(tmp_jpg) #> ‚ïê‚ïê resmush summary ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê #> ‚Ñπ Input: 1 file with size 100.4 Kb #> ‚úî Success for 1 file: Size now is 83.2 Kb (was 100.4 Kb). Saved 17.2 Kb (17.15%). #> See result in directory /tmp/RtmpAjPXvd. resmush_file(tmp_jpg, qlty = 10) #> ‚ïê‚ïê resmush summary ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê #> ‚Ñπ Input: 1 file with size 100.4 Kb #> ‚úî Success for 1 file: Size now is 6.4 Kb (was 100.4 Kb). Saved 94 Kb (93.61%). #> See result in directory /tmp/RtmpAjPXvd. # }

title: Optimize an online file ‚Äî resmush_url
text: Optimize download online image using reSmush.API.

title: Optimize an online file ‚Äî resmush_url
code: resmush_url(   url,   outfile = file.path(tempdir(), basename(url)),   overwrite = FALSE,   progress = TRUE,   report = TRUE,   qlty = 92,   exif_preserve = FALSE )

title: Optimize an online file ‚Äî resmush_url
text: url url vector urls pointing hosted image files. reSmush can optimize following image files: png jpg/jpeg gif bmp tiff outfile Path paths optimized files stored disk. default, temporary files (see tempfile()) basename() file provided url created. length url parameter. overwrite Logical. outfile overwritten (already exists)? FALSE outfile exists create copy numerical suffix (.e. <outfile>.png, <outfile>_01.png, etc.). progress Logical. Display progress bar needed. report Logical. Display summary report process console. See also Value. qlty affects jpg files. Integer 0 100 indicating optimization level. optimal results use values 90. exif_preserve Logical. Exif information () deleted? Default remove (.e. exif_preserve = FALSE).

title: Optimize an online file ‚Äî resmush_url
text: Writes disk optimized file API call successful. cases, (invisible()) data frame summary process returned well. value vector outfile duplicated, resmush_url() rename output suffix _01, _02, etc.

title: Optimize an online file ‚Äî resmush_url
code: # \donttest{  # Base url base_url <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dieghernan/resmush/main/inst/"  png_url <- paste0(base_url, "/extimg/example.png") resmush_url(png_url) #> ‚ïê‚ïê resmush summary ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê #> ‚Ñπ Input: 1 url with size 239.9 Kb #> ‚úî Success for 1 url: Size now is 70.7 Kb (was 239.9 Kb). Saved 169.2 Kb (70.54%). #> See result in directory /tmp/RtmpAjPXvd.  # Several urls jpg_url <- paste0(base_url, "/extimg/example.jpg")  summary <- resmush_url(c(png_url, jpg_url)) #> üïê  Go! | ‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°‚ñ°   50% [1ms] | ETA:  0s (1/2 urls) #> üïê  Go! | ‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†‚ñ†  100% [830ms] | ETA:  0s (2/2 urls) #>  #> ‚ïê‚ïê resmush summary ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê #> ‚Ñπ Input: 2 urls with size 340.2 Kb #> ‚úî Success for 2 urls: Size now is 153.8 Kb (was 340.2 Kb). Saved 186.4 Kb (54.79%). #> See results in directory /tmp/RtmpAjPXvd.  # Returns an (invisible) data frame with a summary of the process summary #>                                                                              src_img #> 1 https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dieghernan/resmush/main/inst//extimg/example.png #> 2 https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dieghernan/resmush/main/inst//extimg/example.jpg #>                         dest_img src_size dest_size compress_ratio notes #> 1 /tmp/RtmpAjPXvd/example_01.png 239.9 Kb   70.7 Kb         70.54%    OK #> 2    /tmp/RtmpAjPXvd/example.jpg 100.4 Kb   83.2 Kb         17.15%    OK #>   src_bytes dest_bytes #> 1    245618      72356 #> 2    102796      85164  # Display with png if (require("png", quietly = TRUE)) {   my_png <- png::readPNG(summary$dest_img[1])   grid::grid.raster(my_png) }   # Use with jpg and parameters resmush_url(jpg_url) #> ‚ïê‚ïê resmush summary ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê #> ‚Ñπ Input: 1 url with size 100.4 Kb #> ‚úî Success for 1 url: Size now is 83.2 Kb (was 100.4 Kb). Saved 17.2 Kb (17.15%). #> See result in directory /tmp/RtmpAjPXvd. resmush_url(jpg_url, qlty = 10) #> ‚ïê‚ïê resmush summary ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê #> ‚Ñπ Input: 1 url with size 100.4 Kb #> ‚úî Success for 1 url: Size now is 6.4 Kb (was 100.4 Kb). Saved 94 Kb (93.61%). #> See result in directory /tmp/RtmpAjPXvd. # }

title: resmush (development version)
text: Minimum R version required now 4.1.0. Migrate documentation Quarto (#28).

title: resmush 0.2.2
text: CRAN release: 2026-01-12 Add httr2::req_headers(referer = "https://dieghernan.github.io/resmush/") corresponding calls. API calls now perform dry run ensure compressed file exists.

title: resmush 0.2.1
text: CRAN release: 2024-12-18 Update documentation.

title: resmush 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-07-19 webp format longer supported API; removed package.

title: resmush 0.1.1
text: CRAN release: 2024-05-22 Update docs.

title: resmush 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-02-02 Accepted CRAN. Now resmush uses httr2 instead httr. Add DOI: https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.10556679. resmush_file(), resmush_dir() resmush_url() gain new argument overwrite. New arguments progress report. Deprecated verbose argument. resmush_clean_dir() shows messages summary process. New packages Suggests examples: png, grid.

title: resmush 0.0.1
text: Initial version.
